body: $ZIM The word "panic" is widely misused. "People fled in panic from the burning building." This is incorrect
created_at: because people have good reason to fear harm in a fire.

body: The idea of panic properly refers to a groundless (usually contagious) fear
created_at: similar to the spontaneous terror that was aroused in people who heard the god Pan play his pipes.

body: If you replace Pan by "analyst" you can see how useful the word is when discussing the behaviour of ZIM stock owners. This is one part of the definition from the OED:

column3: etc.; see A. 1): A sudden and excessive feeling of alarm or fear
column4: usually affecting a body of persons
column5: originating in some real or supposed danger vaguely apprehended
column6: and leading to extravagant or injudicious efforts to secure safety.

$ZIM I sold everything last week. Every stock. I bought some 22.50 calls.  Then today bought some 20 calls. Great deal for them.  Monday I buy into shares after announcement. Really was shock I'd be able to buy in under 20. But it saved me 2 bucks a share selling at 21.50. Now I can buy in cheaper. I couldnt stay in any stock with the bloodbath going on..lol  but looks like evrything has bottomed out. as long as they do a decent divy. It'll be back to 25. If they panick from the market. Andngo low. Stock will stay around 20 for a while. It seriously does feel like a Texas hold em match Like one guy said..lol  but I'm all in for the ride Monday morning.
$ZIM Here's an analogy that explains why the stock price drop does not bother me at all. Imagine I own a house
created_at: and some agent comes around and offers to buy it for $20. I politely decline. He then shows me articles written by his friends that claim the house is worth no more than that. I am worried
column4: I walk down into the basement to check that my chest of money still has $30 in it. Then I go out to the yard to check on my hens that lay golden eggs. They are still laying a few
column5: although not as many as last year. I am hoping for at $4 next year and every year from them. I ask myself
column6: would I give away the house
column7: the treasure chest and all my hens all for the sake of $19 in hand today?
